definitions.definition: To affirm to be correct, true, or genuine.
definitions.example: When will the appraiser attest the date of the painting?

definitions.definition: To certify by signature or oath.
definitions.example: You must attest your will in order for it to be valid.

definitions.definition: To certify in an official capacity.
To supply or be evidence of.
definitions.example: Her fine work attested her ability.

definitions.definition: To call to witness; to invoke.
Proven; shown to be true with evidence
Certified as good, correct, or pure
Of words or languages, proven to have existed by records.
definitions.example: The word slæpwerig (sleep-weary) is attested in the Exeter Book in the form slæpwerigne.
